sen.j: 伊達 宗敦（だて むねあつ、1852年6月20日（嘉永5年5月3日 (旧暦)）－1907年（明治40年）1月6日）は仙台藩知事（在任中の伊達氏の当主は30世14代伊達宗基のまま）で、13代仙台藩主・伊達慶邦の嫡子（のち廃嫡）、男爵。
sen.e: Muneatsu DATE (June 20, 1852 – January 6, 1907) was the governor of the Sendai Domain (Munemoto DATE, the 30th head of the Date clan and the 14th lord of the Sendai Domain, was still the head of the Date clan when Muneatsu was in office), a legitimate child (disinherited later) of the 13th lord of the Sendai Domain, Yoshikuni DATE, and a baron.
sen.cmt: 「30世14代伊達宗基」は、ネットなどに伊達宗基が「仙台藩第14代藩主、伊達氏第30代当主」とありましたので、それを参考に訳出しました。
sen.e: Muneatsu DATE (June 20, 1852 – January 6, 1907) was the governor of the Sendai Domain (although Munemoto DATE, the 30th head of the Date clan and the 14th lord of the Sendai Domain, still remained the head of the Date clan when Muneatsu was in office), a legitimate child (disinherited later) of the 13th lord of the Sendai Domain, Yoshikuni DATE, and a baron.
sen.cmt: 表現変更（）内を文から節にして一文としました。
sen.e: Muneatsu DATE (June 20, 1852 – January 6, 1907) was the governor of the Sendai Domain (although Munemoto DATE, the 30th head of the Date clan and the 14th lord of the Sendai Domain, still remained the head of the Date clan when Muneatsu was in office), a legitimate child (disinherited later) of the 13th lord of the Sendai Domain, Yoshikuni DATE, and a baron.

sen.j: 伊予国宇和島藩主・伊達宗城の次男（五男とも）。
sen.e: He was the second son (or the fifth son) of Munenari DATE, the lord of the Uwajima Domain in Iyo Province.
sen.cmt: 「宇和島藩主」をterms/対訳・定訳ではUwajima clan (宇和島氏)とありましたので、the Uwajima Domainに訂正しました。
sen.e: He was the second son (or the fifth son) of Munenari DATE, the lord of the Uwajima Domain in Iyo Province.
He was the second son (or the fifth son) of Munenari DATE, the lord of the Uwajima Domain in Iyo Province.

sen.j: 正室は広幡基豊の娘、継室は松根三楽の娘。
sen.e: His legal wife was a daughter of Mototoyo HIROHATA, and his second wife was a daughter of Sanraku MATSUNE.
sen.cmt: 「松根三楽」の読み方をネットなどで確認できませんでした。とりあえず、「さんらく まつね＝Sanraku MATSUNE」としました。
sen.e: His legal wife was a daughter of Mototoyo HIROHATA, and his second wife was a daughter of Sanraku MATSUNE.

sen.j: 官位は左京大夫、侍従、正四位。
sen.e: His official court ranks were Sakyo no daibu (Master of the Eastern Capital Offices), Jiju (Chamberlain) and Shoshii (Senior Fourth Rank).

sen.j: 第13代藩主・慶邦の養子となり、本来なら慶邦の後を継いで第14代藩主を継ぐはずであった。
sen.e: Muneatsu was adopted by the 13th lord of the domain, Yoshikuni, and was originally supposed to succeed him as the 14th lord of the domain. However, his foster father became the leader of the Ouetsu-reppan alliance in 1868, and as a result, the father was ordered by the new government army to be placed under house arrest, when even Muneatsu was disinherited. For this reason, he could not succeed Yoshikuni, and Munemoto, his fourth son, succeeded him as the 14th lord of the domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「本来なら慶邦の後を継いで第14代藩主を継ぐはずであったが」の「継いで」と「継ぐ」が続いていましたので、succeedの一度の使用で済ませました。「奥羽列藩同盟」は「奥羽越列藩同盟」の間違いだと思いましたので、the Ouetsu-reppan allianceとしました。
sen.e: Muneatsu was adopted by the 13th lord of the domain, Yoshikuni, and was originally supposed to succeed him as the 14th lord of the domain.
sen.cmt: 3文が同じセルに入っていたたため、分割しました。
sen.e: Muneatsu was adopted by the 13th lord of the domain, Yoshikuni, and was originally supposed to succeed him as the 14th lord of the domain.

sen.j: しかし慶応4年（1868年）に養父・慶邦が奥羽列藩同盟の盟主となったために新政府軍から謹慎を申し付けられたとき、宗敦も廃嫡されてしまった
sen.e: However, his foster father became the leader of the Ouetsu-reppan alliance in 1868, and as a result, the father was ordered by the new government army to be placed under house arrest, when even Muneatsu was disinherited.
sen.cmt: 3文が同じセルに入っていたたため、分割しました。
sen.e: However, his foster father became the leader of the Ouetsu-reppan alliance in 1868, and as a result, the father was ordered by the new government army to be placed under house arrest, when even Muneatsu was disinherited.

sen.j: そのため跡を継ぐことができず、14代藩主には慶邦の四男・宗基が継いだのである。
sen.e: For this reason, he was not able to succeed Yoshikuni, and Munemoto, his fourth son, succeeded him as the 14th lord of the domain.
sen.cmt: 3文が同じセルに入っていたたため、分割しました。
sen.e: For this reason, he was not able to succeed Yoshikuni, and Munemoto, his fourth son, succeeded him as the 14th lord of the domain.

sen.j: しかし宗基は幼少であったため、明治2年（1869年）に版籍奉還された後、宗基は藩知事になったものの幼少のために政務をとることができなかった。
sen.e: However, since Munemoto was a child, he could not attend to government affairs although he was appointed the governor of the domain after Hanseki-hokan (return of the land and people from the feudal lords to the emperor) in 1869.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「幼少」は２度出ていますが、英文では１文にまとめました。
sen.e: However, Munemoto, only a child, was not able to attend to government affairs although appointed the governor of the domain after Hanseki-hokan (return of the land and people from the feudal lords to the emperor) in 1869.
sen.cmt: 2文が同じセルに入っていたたため、分割しました。表現簡潔化
sen.e: However, Munemoto, only a child, was not able to attend to government affairs although appointed the governor of the domain after Hanseki-hokan (return of the land and people from the feudal lords to the emperor) in 1869.

sen.j: 明治3年（1870年）に新政府は宗敦の謹慎を解いて、宗基の代わりに宗敦を新たな藩知事として任命した。
sen.e: Therefore, the new government released Muneatsu from house arrest in 1870 and appointed him new governor of the domain in place of Munemoto.
Therefore, the new government released Muneatsu from house arrest in 1870 and appointed him new governor of the domain in place of Munemoto.

sen.j: 仙台藩知事として実質的な政務を行ったが、伊達氏当主は宗基のままであり、伊達氏当主歴代には数えない。
sen.e: Although Muneatsu actually attended to government affairs as the governor of the Sendai Domain, he is counted out of the successive heads of the Date clan because Munemoto was still the head of the clan.
sen.cmt: 「伊達氏当主」は２度出ていますが、英文では１文にまとめました。
sen.e: Although Muneatsu actually attended to government affairs as the governor of the Sendai Domain, he is counted out of the successive heads of the Date clan because Munemoto was still the head of the clan.

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）の廃藩置県後、イギリスに遊学した。
sen.e: After Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) in 1871, Muneatsu went to Britain to study.
After Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) in 1871, Muneatsu went to Britain to study.

sen.j: 明治17年（1884年）に新たに家を興し、明治21年（1888年）には男爵となった。
sen.e: He started a home in 1884, and was created a baron in 1888.
sen.cmt: 「新たに家を興し」は「家庭を持つ」と解釈し、started a homeとしました。「男爵となった」は、「男爵に列せられた」と解釈しwas created a baronとしましたが、became a baronも可です。
sen.e: He started a new family of DATE in 1884, and was awarded the title of baron in 1888.
sen.cmt: 家は、家制度の「家」と思われますので、familyの方がbetterと判断しました。また男爵の地位を与えられたという方にしました。
sen.e: He started a new family of DATE in 1884, and was awarded the title of baron in 1888.

sen.j: 明治23年（1890年）以降は貴族院 (日本)議員。
sen.e: He served as a member of Kizokuin (Japan's House of Peers) since 1890.

sen.j: 明治40年（1907年）に56歳で死去。
sen.e: In 1907, he died at the age of 56.
